body.p:
Greenupsburg, KY,
July 16, 1861,
Hon B. Magoffin,
Sir,

John W. Prince was fined at the Greenup Circuit Court, May Term 1861, the sum of $70 for fighting, and Mr Hugh Craycraft, a worthy and respectable citizen of the county, became his security on the repleivin bond, Prince is wholly unable to pay, and Mr Craycraft asks a release of the judgment. He is a good citizen, a poor man, with a large family, and I respectfully unite with him in asking that the judgment be remitted

Respectfully,
R. H. Stanton
Com. atty

Dr. Magoffin -- The above statement is true as I understand from Mr. Stanton the commonwealths Atty for the district, and from other gentleman of standing and character in whom I have full confidence. My judgment is that the fine, at least as much of it as you have power over ^should^ be remitted -- A respite would only defer the day of payment, & at the expiration of the time if the present condition of affairs continue, he would be as little able to pay as at present. I hope therefore you will remit this fine as it is one among the few cases of true merit that come before your Excellency.
I have the honor to be very Respectfully your obedient servt.

J R Brown
Wm Corum
Ed F Dulin
J W Waring
Henry M Rust
B. J. McComas
Jesse Corum
Geo. E. Roe
